016package app.supernaut.fx;
017
018import app.supernaut.fx.internal.DefaultFxMainView;
019import javafx.application.Application;
020import javafx.stage.Stage;
021import app.supernaut.ForegroundApp;
022
023import java.util.Optional;
024
025/**
026 * <b>Supernaut.FX</b> applications must implement this interface.
027 * <p>
028 * This is the <b>Supernaut.FX</b> specialization of <b>Supernaut</b> {@link ForegroundApp}. Supernaut.FX {@link FxForegroundApp}s
029 * implement this interface instead of subclassing <b>JavaFX</b> {@link Application}. This has several
030 * advantages over directly extending {@link javafx.application.Application}:
031 * <ol>
032 *     <li>
033 *       Applications {@code implement} an {@code interface} rather than {@code extend} a {@code class}.
034 *       This increases the testability and architectural flexibility of the application.
035 *     </li>
036 *     <li>
037 *         Abstracts {@link Stage} with {@link FxMainView}. This also helps with testing.
038 *     </li>
039 *     <li>
040 *         Supports faster, multi-threaded launching with the {@link FxLauncher} interface.
041 *     </li>
042 *     <li>
043 *         Supports flexible construction of application object hierarchies using Dependency Injection provided
044 *         by <b>MicronautÂ®</b> framework and possibly other D.I. frameworks in the future.
045 *     </li>
046 * </ol>
047 * If you don't care to use the {@link FxMainView} abstraction, you can implement {@link FxApplicationCompat} and
048 * implement the {@link FxApplicationCompat#start(Stage)} method which is compatible with {@link Application#start(Stage)}.
049 */
050public interface FxForegroundApp extends ForegroundApp {
051    /**
052     * The application initialization method. This method is called from the JavaFX
053     * init() method after the dependency injection context is initialized and the
054     * application is constructed and dependency injected.
055     *
056     * <p>
057     * NOTE: This method is not called on the JavaFX Application Thread. An
058     * application must not construct a Scene or a Stage in this
059     * method.
060     * An application may construct other JavaFX objects in this method.
061     * </p>
062     * @throws java.lang.Exception if something goes wrong
063     */
064    @Override
065    default void init() throws Exception {};
066
067    /**
068     * Adapt from OpenJFX-independent {@link ForegroundApp} to JFX-compatible {@link FxForegroundApp}
069     * which requires a primary {@link Stage} to start.
070     * 
071     * @param mainView Must be a {@link FxMainView}
072     * @throws Exception if something goes wrong
073     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if mainView isn't a {@link FxMainView}
074     */
075    @Override
076    default void start(Object mainView) throws Exception {
077        if (mainView instanceof FxMainView) {
078            start((FxMainView) mainView);
079        } else if (mainView instanceof Stage) {
080            start((Stage) mainView);
081        } else {
082            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Main view must be implementation of: " + Stage.class);
083        }
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * The main entry point for Supernaut.fx applications. Called from {@link Application#start(Stage)}.
088     * At a minimum, you must implement this method.
089     * <p>
090     * NOTE: This method is called on the JavaFX Application Thread.
091     *
092     * @param mainView A wrapper view containing the primary {@link Stage}
093     * @throws java.lang.Exception if something goes wrong
094     * @deprecated use {@link FxForegroundApp#start(Stage)}
095     */
096    @Deprecated
097    default void start(FxMainView mainView) throws Exception {
098        start((Object) mainView);
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * You should override this method, it will become abstract in the future
103     *
104     * @param primaryStage the primary stage
105     * @throws Exception something went wrong
106     */
107    default void start(Stage primaryStage) throws Exception {
108        start(DefaultFxMainView.of(primaryStage));
109    }
110    
111    /**
112     * This method is called when the application should stop, and provides a
113     * convenient place to prepare for application exit and destroy resources.
114     * <p>
115     * NOTE: This method is called on the JavaFX Application Thread.
116     *
117     * @throws java.lang.Exception if something goes wrong
118     */
119    @Override
120    default void stop() throws Exception {};
121
122    /**
123     * A OpenJFX-compatible {@link SupernautMainView} that potentially contains a {@link Stage}.
124     * We are trying to make having a {@link Stage} optional, because in test environments (and perhaps <b>macOS</b> apps
125     * if someday OpenJFX gets better <b>macOS</b> support) the Stage may not be present.
126     * @deprecated We're eliminating the concept of abstracted views, use {@link Stage} directly
127     */
128    @Deprecated
129    interface FxMainView extends SupernautMainView {
130        /**
131         * Show the stage/view
132         */
133        void show();
134
135        /**
136         * @return The {@link Stage} this view is contained in (if any)
137         */
138        Optional<Stage> optionalStage();
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * This interface makes converting from an instance of {@link Application} easier.
143     * <p>Simply change:
144     * <p>{@code class MyFXForegroundApp extends Application}
145     * <p>to
146     * <p>{@code class MyFXForegroundApp implements FxApplicationCompat}
147     * @deprecated {@link FxForegroundApp} should be used directly
148     */
149    @Deprecated
150    interface FxApplicationCompat extends FxForegroundApp {
151        /**
152         * Start method compatible with OpenJFX start method
153         *
154         * @param primaryStage primary stage (unwrapped)
155         */
156        void start(Stage primaryStage);
157        default void start(FxMainView mainView) {
158            start(mainView.optionalStage().orElseThrow());
159        }
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Implement this interface if you need access to the {@link Application} object instance
164     * @deprecated If you need {@link Application} inject it in your constructor
165     */
166    @Deprecated
167    interface OpenJfxApplicationAware extends ForegroundApp {
168        /**
169         * Setter that will receive the {@link Application} instance
170         * @param application reference to the OpenJFX application
171         */
172        void setJfxApplication(Application application);
173    }
174}
